Leave No Americans Behind Act of 2022
To amend the State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956 to eliminate the repatriation loan program, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

bill.summary:
Leave No Americans Behind Act of 2022
This bill eliminates the Department of State's repatriation loan program. The program currently authorizes the State Department to loan funds to private U.S. citizens and third-country nationals for emergency evacuation from foreign countries where their lives are endangered by war, civil unrest, or natural disasters, rather than expending appropriated funds.
